com.lambda.graphics
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  com.lambda.graphics.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpriteSheet
public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

The 'Sprite' holds the representation of an 'Object'. It is what is displayed to the screen, when anything is being rendered.

Author:
alex

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

Sprite

public Sprite(java.lang.String path,
              int width,
              int height)
       throws LambdaException
Creates a new 'Sprite' with a given size and loads the Image for it for the path 'path' given as a String. The 'width' and the 'height' of the 'Sprite' may not be less than 0, otherwise they will be set to 0.

Parameters:
path - The path to the image to use for the 'Sprite'.
width - The width of the 'Sprite'.
height - The height of the 'Sprite'.
Throws:
LambdaException - If the path does not point to a valid image, or the image could not be loaded successfully.

Sprite

public Sprite(org.newdawn.slick.opengl.Texture texture,
              int width,
              int height)
Creates a new 'Sprite' with a given size and a 'Texture'. The 'width' and the 'height' of the 'Sprite' may not be less than 0, otherwise they will be set to 0.

Parameters:
texture - The 'Texture' the 'Sprite' will use.
width - The width of the 'Sprite'.
height - The height of the 'Sprite'.
Method Detail

render

public void render(float x,
                   float y)
Renders the 'Sprite' to the screen. This will only work if the 'texture' of the 'Sprite' is not 'null'.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate the 'Sprite' will be rendered at.
y - The y-coordinate the 'Sprite' will be rendered at.

update

public void update()
Executes the 'Sprites' logic.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Gives back the width of the 'Sprite'.

Returns:
The width of the 'Sprite'.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Gives back the height of the 'Sprite'.

Returns:
The height of the 'Sprite'.

setSize

public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
Sets the width of the 'Sprite' to 'width' and its height to 'height'.

Parameters:
width - The new width of the 'Sprite'.
height - The new height of the 'Sprite'.
